headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Craig Kieswetter c Lakmal b Randiv 61 (56b 4x4 2x6 90m) SR: 108.92

dismissalComment.html: a slog-sweep, a top-edge, and a simple catch for short third man, running in. Lakmal - who didn't have the best time in the field during the Tests - is all smiles after holding onto that. England are scoring at a decent lick, but these wickets will keep Sri Lanka in the game

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Eoin Morgan c Kandamby b Lakmal 45 (35b 6x4 0x6 34m) SR: 128.57

dismissalComment.html: Lakmal's slower ball does for Morgan. Picked it too late but went through with a lofted drive, only succeeded in lifting it to long-off. Ends a dazzling little innings and a crucial strike for Sri Lanka

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Cook's gone! An innocuous delivery, tailing down the leg-side, Cook goes for the leg glance but gets nothing more than a feather through to the keeper

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone this time! Bresnan tried to walk across his stumps and dink Malinga round the corner. He missed, it struck his back leg. It looked plumb on first viewing but replays showed it heading a long way down leg. Crucial little cameo though from Bresnan
Broad falls on the last ball, not sure he timed a single delivery that innings. Here he tries to work to leg and a leading edge finds cover

headshotImage.caption: Kevin Pietersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kevin Pietersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kevin Pietersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kevin Pietersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kevin Pietersen c Dilshan b Mendis 26 (24b 3x4 0x6 30m) SR: 108.33

dismissalComment.html: and he's got him with his first ball! Terrible ball, a rank long-hop, but KP leaned back and pulled straight into the hands of Dilshan at midwicket, and Sri Lanka are delighted. The batsmen had started to tick along quite nicely, and this will ease Sri Lanka's nerves ... although, now they'll have Eoin Morgan to deal with

dismissalText.commentary: Ian Bell lbw b Jayasuriya 12 (16b 1x4 0x6 23m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: Bell goes now! England stuttering. Jayasuriya celebrates and it was good bowling, took the pace off the ball and Bell shuffled around the crease before getting down to sweep. Missed it and was struck plumb in front

dismissalText.commentary: Tim Bresnan lbw b Malinga 23 (14b 4x4 0x6 25m) SR: 164.28

dismissalComment.html: gone this time! Bresnan tried to walk across his stumps and dink Malinga round the corner. He missed, it struck his back leg. It looked plumb on first viewing but replays showed it heading a long way down leg. Crucial little cameo though from Bresnan

dismissalText.commentary: Stuart Broad c Kandamby b Malinga 13 (19b 0x4 0x6 22m) SR: 68.42

dismissalComment.html: Broad falls on the last ball, not sure he timed a single delivery that innings. Here he tries to work to leg and a leading edge finds cover

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga c sub (RS Bopara) b Swann 26 (15b 4x4 1x6 23m) SR: 173.33

dismissalComment.html: gone, finally. Malinga this time can't land one of his big leg-side clumps, instead a bit of drift finds a top edge that loops high towards point where Bopara holds the chance

headshotImage.caption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Suraj Randiv st †Kieswetter b Swann 24 (27b 3x4 0x6 36m) SR: 88.88

dismissalComment.html: that's it! Kieswetter finishes things off with a swift stumping as Randiv gropes and misses outside off stump

what a slice of luck for Anderson, shoved a length ball down the leg side but Dilshan's flick flew down to Bresnan who ran in to take the catch. So both captains depart to leg-side strangles, different styles admittedly

there's some swing! This might be the fullest ball Anderson has bowled today, and it's wobbled appreciably back in to beat the inside edge and ping Jayawardene's left pad ... the finger goes up, that's out!

there goes another one! Full again from Anderson, a touch of swing and Sangakkara is too early into a straight drive, popping the ball straight back to the bowler, who holds the catch in his follow through. Two wickets in the over for Anderson, and Sri Lanka are tottering now.
excellent work from Anderson. Two sharp short balls followed by a sucker full one, and with Kulasekara hanging back, he spoons it tamely to mid-on where Cook dives forward to take a good catch

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: another one down. This is ending in a hurry. Mendis edges down the wicket and chips a catch to short midwicket. Very easy indeed
gone, finally. Malinga this time can't land one of his big leg-side clumps, instead a bit of drift finds a top edge that loops high towards point where Bopara holds the chance

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Bresnan b Anderson 1 (2b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: what a slice of luck for Anderson, shoved a length ball down the leg side but Dilshan's flick flew down to Bresnan who ran in to take the catch. So both captains depart to leg-side strangles, different styles admittedly

headshotImage.caption: Sanath Jayasuriya player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sanath Jayasuriya player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Sanath Jayasuriya player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sanath Jayasuriya player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sanath Jayasuriya c Morgan b Bresnan 2 (4b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: he's gone! The shot that brought him so many of his 13,430 runs in one-day cricket - a scything cut - but this time it's gone straight into the hands of Morgan at point. No grand finish for Sanath, but he leaves the field to warm applause from the large crowd. Goodbye to a Sri Lankan legend.

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene lbw b Anderson 5 (11b 0x4 0x6 17m) SR: 45.45

dismissalComment.html: there's some swing! This might be the fullest ball Anderson has bowled today, and it's wobbled appreciably back in to beat the inside edge and ping Jayawardene's left pad ... the finger goes up, that's out!

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c & b Anderson 4 (10b 1x4 0x6 13m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: there goes another one! Full again from Anderson, a touch of swing and Sangakkara is too early into a straight drive, popping the ball straight back to the bowler, who holds the catch in his follow through. Two wickets in the over for Anderson, and Sri Lanka are tottering now.

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c Anderson b Dernbach 16 (16b 3x4 0x6 29m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: what a catch! Dernbach dug one in short and Mathews was quickly into the pull, but hit the ball in the air towards midwicket where Anderson went airborne, leaping to his right to complete the dismissal. Dernbach's first wicket in ODIs, and it's snapped what was just beginning to turn into a fightback from Sri Lanka

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jeevan Mendis c Anderson b Swann 9 (15b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: another one down. This is ending in a hurry. Mendis edges down the wicket and chips a catch to short midwicket. Very easy indeed

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara c Cook b Anderson 5 (14b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 35.71

dismissalComment.html: excellent work from Anderson. Two sharp short balls followed by a sucker full one, and with Kulasekara hanging back, he spoons it tamely to mid-on where Cook dives forward to take a good catch

headshotImage.caption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Thilina Kandamby c Broad b Dernbach 19 (48b 1x4 0x6 75m) SR: 39.58

dismissalComment.html: Dernbach replaces Anderson and strikes straight away! Short ball rushes onto Kandamby and the pull shot gets high on the bat and loops to mid-on. Dernbach celebrates with a Freddie-style arms-aloft pose, make of that what you will

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot
off side drive on front foot

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Suraj Randiv st †Kieswetter b Swann 24 (27b 3x4 0x6 36m) SR: 88.88

commentTextItems.html: that's it! Kieswetter finishes things off with a swift stumping as Randiv gropes and misses outside off stump

commentPostTextItems.html: Righty, you can read all about this game in Andrew Miller's bulletin we also have a gallery and Gnasher's Plays of the Day. That's enough from us, thanks for the emails, please join us for the second game at Headingley on Friday.

Anderson named man of the match "I was delighted get my place back in the side," he says. "You've always got a point to prove. It was a long winter and we've had a good break now and feel more refreshed. I pride myself on my fielding and it's nice to hold a good one like today."

Cook: "I thought we handled the rain break and came back very well then the bowlers then got us off to a great start. The way Kieswetter and Pietersen played was  also excellent and then we got that good partnership at the end. It's good to have Anderson back but we've got to keep our feet on the ground and keep working hard."

Dilshan: "I'm happy to come back but unfortunately I couldn't get any runs today. It was a tough chase but England bowled well and deserved to win. We didn't get the start we wanted and it was tough from there. As a team we still have a lot of confidence. Sanath has done a great job for Sri Lanka cricket for 22 years, he changed world cricket in 1996."  "He'll always have my vote," says Dilshan with a smile.

England win by 110 runs Emphatic victory for England. The conditions suited them but they blew Sri Lanka away. James Anderson's return to ODI cricket was a happy one, ripping the heart out of Sri Lanka's top order and Graeme Swann finished it off. Good start to Cook's full-time reign, England were very sharp in the field. In conditions that were a bit grim Sri Lanka didn't really fancy it. Sanath Jayasuriya's comeback farewell innings didn't quite go as planned but it's difficult when you've been out of top-level cricket for so long.

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: played and missed outside off stump
Randiv slices a cut to point, the required rate just past 20, so England in with a chance

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga c sub (RS Bopara) b Swann 26 (15b 4x4 1x6 23m) SR: 173.33

commentTextItems.html: gone, finally. Malinga this time can't land one of his big leg-side clumps, instead a bit of drift finds a top edge that loops high towards point where Bopara holds the chance
swept hard around the corner
Randiv works this into the leg side
good delivery to finish the over. On a good length, moving away and driven without much timing to mid-off

headshotImage.caption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: short ball from Broad, Randiv stays leg side and helps it over point for a boundary
steered to point this time
lovely drive from Randiv this time, punching the ball at the top of its bounce to the sweeper on the cover boundary
it was short, but a slower bouncer, and Malinga wheels it to midwicket

commentPreTextItems.html: Stuart Broad is back, looking to get something into the wicket column.

commentTextItems.html: ouch. Broad won't go full again after this! Malinga backs away and creams this through cover, rocketed to the fence
tries to repeat the dose, doesn't time it as well this time and it reaches long-on on the bounce

headshotImage.caption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Malinga has seen enough! One foot down, big heave across the line and he's got plenty of it. Sends it two-rows deep into the stands at cow corner
open-face steer towards point where Bopara fields
another play and miss outside off stump. No spin for Swann with the damp conditions
this is driven down to long on
the Powerplay has ended so Swann is back starts by sliding this past Malinga's outside edge
another good shot, off the back foot this time, Randiv hanging leg side of the ball and punching a drive to deep point, Pietersen scoots round from third man to field

dismissalComment.html: gone this time! Bresnan tried to walk across his stumps and dink Malinga round the corner. He missed, it struck his back leg. It looked plumb on first viewing but replays showed it heading a long way down leg. Crucial little cameo though from Bresnan
Broad falls on the last ball, not sure he timed a single delivery that innings. Here he tries to work to leg and a leading edge finds cover

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: Jonathan Trott player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jonathan Trott player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone this time! Top work from Lakmal, full, straight, and clumping Trott on the toe as he played around his pad

Lakmal's slower ball does for Morgan. Picked it too late but went through with a lofted drive, only succeeded in lifting it to long-off. Ends a dazzling little innings and a crucial strike for Sri Lanka

headshotImage.caption: Sanath Jayasuriya player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sanath Jayasuriya player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Bell goes now! England stuttering. Jayasuriya celebrates and it was good bowling, took the pace off the ball and Bell shuffled around the crease before getting down to sweep. Missed it and was struck plumb in front

headshotImage.caption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: a slog-sweep, a top-edge, and a simple catch for short third man, running in. Lakmal - who didn't have the best time in the field during the Tests - is all smiles after holding onto that. England are scoring at a decent lick, but these wickets will keep Sri Lanka in the game

headshotImage.caption: Kevin Pietersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kevin Pietersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and he's got him with his first ball! Terrible ball, a rank long-hop, but KP leaned back and pulled straight into the hands of Dilshan at midwicket, and Sri Lanka are delighted. The batsmen had started to tick along quite nicely, and this will ease Sri Lanka's nerves ... although, now they'll have Eoin Morgan to deal with

dismissalText.commentary: Alastair Cook c †Sangakkara b Malinga 5 (3b 1x4 0x6 9m) SR: 166.66

dismissalComment.html: Cook's gone! An innocuous delivery, tailing down the leg-side, Cook goes for the leg glance but gets nothing more than a feather through to the keeper

dismissalComment.html: and he's got him with his first ball! Terrible ball, a rank long-hop, but KP leaned back and pulled straight into the hands of Dilshan at midwicket, and Sri Lanka are delighted. The batsmen had started to tick along quite nicely, and this will ease Sri Lanka's nerves ... although, now they'll have Eoin Morgan to deal with

dismissalText.commentary: Craig Kieswetter c Lakmal b Randiv 61 (56b 4x4 2x6 90m) SR: 108.92

dismissalComment.html: a slog-sweep, a top-edge, and a simple catch for short third man, running in. Lakmal - who didn't have the best time in the field during the Tests - is all smiles after holding onto that. England are scoring at a decent lick, but these wickets will keep Sri Lanka in the game

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Eoin Morgan c Kandamby b Lakmal 45 (35b 6x4 0x6 34m) SR: 128.57

dismissalComment.html: Lakmal's slower ball does for Morgan. Picked it too late but went through with a lofted drive, only succeeded in lifting it to long-off. Ends a dazzling little innings and a crucial strike for Sri Lanka

headshotImage.caption: Sanath Jayasuriya player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sanath Jayasuriya player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ian Bell lbw b Jayasuriya 12 (16b 1x4 0x6 23m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: Bell goes now! England stuttering. Jayasuriya celebrates and it was good bowling, took the pace off the ball and Bell shuffled around the crease before getting down to sweep. Missed it and was struck plumb in front

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tim Bresnan lbw b Malinga 23 (14b 4x4 0x6 25m) SR: 164.28

dismissalComment.html: gone this time! Bresnan tried to walk across his stumps and dink Malinga round the corner. He missed, it struck his back leg. It looked plumb on first viewing but replays showed it heading a long way down leg. Crucial little cameo though from Bresnan

dismissalText.commentary: Stuart Broad c Kandamby b Malinga 13 (19b 0x4 0x6 22m) SR: 68.42

dismissalComment.html: Broad falls on the last ball, not sure he timed a single delivery that innings. Here he tries to work to leg and a leading edge finds cover

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Bresnan b Anderson 1 (2b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: what a slice of luck for Anderson, shoved a length ball down the leg side but Dilshan's flick flew down to Bresnan who ran in to take the catch. So both captains depart to leg-side strangles, different styles admittedly

headshotImage.caption: Sanath Jayasuriya player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sanath Jayasuriya player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Sanath Jayasuriya player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sanath Jayasuriya player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sanath Jayasuriya c Morgan b Bresnan 2 (4b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: he's gone! The shot that brought him so many of his 13,430 runs in one-day cricket - a scything cut - but this time it's gone straight into the hands of Morgan at point. No grand finish for Sanath, but he leaves the field to warm applause from the large crowd. Goodbye to a Sri Lankan legend.

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene lbw b Anderson 5 (11b 0x4 0x6 17m) SR: 45.45

dismissalComment.html: there's some swing! This might be the fullest ball Anderson has bowled today, and it's wobbled appreciably back in to beat the inside edge and ping Jayawardene's left pad ... the finger goes up, that's out!

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c & b Anderson 4 (10b 1x4 0x6 13m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: there goes another one! Full again from Anderson, a touch of swing and Sangakkara is too early into a straight drive, popping the ball straight back to the bowler, who holds the catch in his follow through. Two wickets in the over for Anderson, and Sri Lanka are tottering now.

headshotImage.caption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Thilina Kandamby c Broad b Dernbach 19 (48b 1x4 0x6 75m) SR: 39.58

dismissalComment.html: Dernbach replaces Anderson and strikes straight away! Short ball rushes onto Kandamby and the pull shot gets high on the bat and loops to mid-on. Dernbach celebrates with a Freddie-style arms-aloft pose, make of that what you will

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c Anderson b Dernbach 16 (16b 3x4 0x6 29m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: what a catch! Dernbach dug one in short and Mathews was quickly into the pull, but hit the ball in the air towards midwicket where Anderson went airborne, leaping to his right to complete the dismissal. Dernbach's first wicket in ODIs, and it's snapped what was just beginning to turn into a fightback from Sri Lanka

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jeevan Mendis c Anderson b Swann 9 (15b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: another one down. This is ending in a hurry. Mendis edges down the wicket and chips a catch to short midwicket. Very easy indeed

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara c Cook b Anderson 5 (14b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 35.71

dismissalComment.html: excellent work from Anderson. Two sharp short balls followed by a sucker full one, and with Kulasekara hanging back, he spoons it tamely to mid-on where Cook dives forward to take a good catch

headshotImage.caption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Suraj Randiv st †Kieswetter b Swann 24 (27b 3x4 0x6 36m) SR: 88.88

dismissalComment.html: that's it! Kieswetter finishes things off with a swift stumping as Randiv gropes and misses outside off stump

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga c sub (RS Bopara) b Swann 26 (15b 4x4 1x6 23m) SR: 173.33

dismissalComment.html: gone, finally. Malinga this time can't land one of his big leg-side clumps, instead a bit of drift finds a top edge that loops high towards point where Bopara holds the chance

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

notes: England innings
Rain: England - 0/0
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 7.0 (Mandatory - 35 runs, 1 wicket)
Rain: England - 35/1 in 7.0 overs (C Kieswetter 13, IJL Trott 14)
18 overs lost
Powerplay 2: Overs 7.1 - 10.0 (Bowling side - 27 runs, 1 wicket)
England: 50 runs in 8.4 overs (53 balls), Extras 3
Powerplay 3: Overs 10.1 - 13.0 (Batting side - 17 runs, 0 wicket)
England: 100 runs in 14.6 overs (91 balls), Extras 3
C Kieswetter: 50 off 45 balls (3 x 4, 2 x 6)
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 36 balls (C Kieswetter 28, KP Pietersen 23, Ex 0)
England: 150 runs in 21.2 overs (129 balls), Extras 3
England: 200 runs in 29.4 overs (179 balls), Extras 13
Innings Break: England - 229/8 in 32.0 overs (GP Swann 2)
Sri Lanka innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 7.0 (Mandatory - 23 runs, 4 wickets)
Powerplay 2: Overs 7.1 - 10.0 (Bowling side - 11 runs, 0 wicket)
Sri Lanka: 50 runs in 14.2 overs (86 balls), Extras 4
Powerplay 3: Overs 20.1 - 23.0 (Batting side - 24 runs, 1 wicket)
Sri Lanka: 100 runs in 24.2 overs (146 balls), Extras 10
9th Wicket: 50 runs in 28 balls (S Randiv 20, SL Malinga 26, Ex 4)

stories.title: England v Sri Lanka in England, 2011
stories.subTitle: First ODI
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the first ODI, England v Sri Lanka in England, 2011

stories.title: Old guard takes charge to herald new era
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval
stories.seoTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval: Old guard takes charge to herald new era
stories.summary: England's performance bore no resemblance to the fatigued 10-wicket loss in the World Cup quarter-final three months ago

image.caption: Alastair Cook issues directions in the field
image.longCaption: Alastair Cook issues directions in the field, England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval, June 28 2011

stories.title: Goodbye, Sanath
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval
stories.seoTitle: England v Sri Lanka: Goodbye, Sanath
stories.summary: Plays of the Day from the first one-day international between England and Sri Lanka at The Oval

image.caption: Sanath Jayasuriya fell for just 2 in his 445th and final ODI appearance
image.longCaption: Sanath Jayasuriya fell for just 2 in his 445th and final ODI appearance, England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval, June 28 2011

stories.title: Anderson stars in 110-run rout
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval
stories.seoTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval: Anderson stars in 110-run rout
stories.summary: Tillakaratne Dilshan marked his return to action after a broken thumb by winning the toss for Sri Lanka, and choosing to bowl first in the opening ODI against England at The Oval

image.caption: Craig Kieswetter raised the tempo after the rain break
image.longCaption: Craig Kieswetter raised the tempo after the rain break, England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval, June 28 2011

stories.title: Captain Cook takes the helm
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval
stories.seoTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval: Captain Cook takes the helm
stories.summary: Cricinfo previews the first ODI of Sri Lanka's tour of England

image.caption: Alastair Cook, flanked by Ian Bell and Jonathan Trott, warms up for the first ODI
image.longCaption: Alastair Cook, flanked by Ian Bell and Jonathan Trott, warms up for the first ODI, The Oval, June 27, 2011

stories.title: One-day job is Cook's biggest test
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval
stories.seoTitle: England v Sri Lanka: One-day job is Cook's biggest test
stories.summary: England's third captain in eight days has a tough task to secure results for the team but also convince about his own one-day credentials

image.caption: Alastair Cook finds his groove in the nets before the first one-day international
image.longCaption: Alastair Cook finds his groove in the nets before the first one-day international, The Oval, June 27, 2011

stories.title: Jayasuriya poised for farewell match
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval
stories.seoTitle: England v Sri Lanka: Jayasuriya poised for farewell match
stories.summary: Sanath Jayasuriya will bring to an end a 22-year international career when he makes his final appearance for his country at the venue - The Oval - where he made his highest score against England in all formats: 213 off 278 balls in the one-off Test 13 yea

image.caption: Sanath Jayasuriya picked up two cheap wickets on his return to the Sri Lankan side
image.longCaption: Sanath Jayasuriya picked up two cheap wickets on his return to the Sri Lankan side, England v Sri Lanka, Twenty20, Bristol, June 25 2011

stories.title: Bresnan returns to England one-day squad
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval
stories.seoTitle: England v Sri Lanka: Tim Bresnan returns to England one-day squad
stories.summary: England's bowling options for their five-match ODI series against Sri Lanka have been given a boost following Tim Bresnan's recovery from a calf strain

image.caption: Tim Bresnan finished with figures of 5 for 48
